children.value: Lady Margaret Hunt has alerted you to a ship that was stolen from the Queen. They must be stopped and fast, for they could fool anyone into believing they actually work for the Crown.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt has lost something that is very dear to her, a locket with the portrait of his brother Benjamin. She has asked you to retrieve it for her.

children.name: Text
children.value: The ship of a royal ally was attacked during the night by a mysterious foe. Margaret Hunt has requested you to salvage the remains and deliver them to her, to start the funerary arrangements.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt is worried about a group of castaways that got shipwrecked after a storm. She has asked you to rescue them and take them to her, to warm them up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Someone has vandalised Benjamin Harlow's burial place and scattered the wreaths over the sea. Margaret Hunt has requested you to restore them to her.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt has heard a lot of good things about you from the Queen, so she has decided to trust you in escorting her. And she would also like you to make sure your flag is very visible besides hers when you pass by royal eyes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt has news of a merchant ship that has been coming across some cumbersome inconveniences. She would like you to escort them to her harbour until it's safe for them again.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Hunt wants the player to escort a scientist who just made a "great discovery", the greatest discovery. Really. She will be able to save humanity.

She is afraid others might want to stop this or steal the knowledge/ideas, so asks for an escort just in case (do we spawn attackers?)

Maybe royale attackers? Or is this too direct?

She portrays the mission as "for the good of humanity", can't imagine anyone wanting to interfere - then there are a lot of attackers, makes the player wonder if intentions are good.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret Hunt has asked you to escort her ship carrying a substantial donation for the poverty-striken children of the New World, since they have been robbed in the past.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret would like you to escort one of her guests back home before his unabashed drinking gets him in trouble.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret organised a snake exhibition in loving memory of her late husband, Gilbard Hunt. Now that the exhibition is over, the animals must be safley returned to their habitat, the rainforests of the New World.

children.name: Text
children.value: A ship failed to pick up their cargo from Margaret Hunt's harbour. She has asked you to carefully return the merchandise to them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Even if Anne Harlow and her aunt Margaret parted ways long ago, the latter cannot help but worry about her kin. There is no way for her to help her directly, but you can.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret knows that, in order to make things go as one plans, one must sometimes make concessions. This time, she knows Alonso Graves is a ticking bomb that must be appeased before it explodes.

children.name: Text
children.value: An unknown party has recently docked at Madame Kahina's Harbour. Margaret Hunt wants to know who they are and, more importantly, on whose side they are.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your relationship with Margaret Hunt could be better. She would like you to have a cordial relationship again, which is why she has tasked you with a simple delivery to begin working together again.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret still cares about her niece Anne. She wants you to bring her a present from her, to remind her that she will always be welcome at her house.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret is devastated about Sir Archibald's decision to question the good work of her organisation, The Promise Trust. She has written letters of appeal for her fellow council members to hopefully make them reconsider their decisions in her favour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt has given you instructions to follow and report everything you learn about a suspicious ship that's roaming around the region in behalf of the Queen.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret loves the royal residence on High Clarence Hall, aesthetically speaking. She has commissioned you to take a close picture of the place, for ornamental purposes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret Hunt has come to respect you, something few people can say. She has a gift for you, something to show you she likes you on her side, along with an apology.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret Hunt wants to cook a special recipe for a party held by the Royal Council, if you can provide her with the ingredients.

children.name: Text
children.value: Although Lady Margaret will not be able to attend, she still wants you to make sure Sir Archibald receives it in time for the event.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret's shipment of beer was contaminated and she is worried the lives of her men and women will be in danger if the brew reaches them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret is happy you managed to destroy the contaminated beer before it reached her crew, but they still need it, if you can deliver it to them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Margaret Hunt's Promise Trust is ready to make a big announcement to society: they are close to discovering a cure for the flu. Many distinguished guests are getting ready to attend, and Lady Margaret has asked you to escort them.

children.name: Text
children.value: After the successful announcement, The Promise Trust is ready to start looking for their first test subjects. Lady Margaret has prepared leaflets to spread around the region and recruit as many people as possible.

children.name: Text
children.value: The leaflets were a success, countless people signed up with the hope of becoming the firsts on being healed from the terrible sickness. They need to be escorted to Lady Margaret's harbour in order to proceed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Only a few more things are required for the research to continue. The Promise Trust's main researcher has arrived at Madame Kahina's harbour and he needs to be taken to Lady Margaret, along with a few, last minute materials.

children.name: Text
children.value: Who knows when calamity might hit our loved ones. I abhor violence, but I am not blinded to the fact that there are only a certain number of ways some tragedies can be aborted. Bring weapons to my relatives. An old woman like me would not survive the shock of losing them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Terrible how many lives have been taken by the humble spud. I will have The Promise Trust investigate the toxic properties of the tuber. Deliver enough samples to me.

children.name: Text
children.value: ...then all proceeds to schedule- Oh, hello my young acquaintance. I presently have need of some dynamite, for a household project of course.

children.name: Text
children.value: I believe in slow penance for wrongdoers - counting grain, for example. You see, if even small crimes go unpunished, one's whole world may go to seed.

children.name: Text
children.value: The bitter winter will soon be upon us, and I have taken on draping us off the cold. Bring me cloth, dear, so that the final curtain may fall.

children.name: Text
children.value: I assume you are aware of what became of my dear brother Benjamin. I think of him every day, every day from the moment I wake... His memory must be honoured.

children.name: Text
children.value: My yearly masquerade is the most anticipated event among the high-society. Curious how people are only their true selves once they are behind a mask... Anyhow, there will be plenty of beverages and titbits, I believe it will do you good to be one of my suppliers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Only a fool would dismiss the value of religion. Herds of people follow every sacred word blindly... And so do I, of course! I have endeavoured to craft the most captivating symbol of God in the Old World. I will be needing the finest materials, child.

children.name: Text
children.value: Earl Smedley is a sworn enemy of the Crown and a danger to us all! Indeed a cruel, souless man that didn't even flinch when his horse crushed my poor kitten to death. I have never forgotten.

children.name: Text
children.value: "I noticed a ship pretending to be a trading ship, then attacking other ships. Someone has to take care of it before it can cause even more trouble. Would you be so kind?"

children.name: Text
children.value: Do not let their innocent façade fool you, for that schooner trades nothing but poisonous snakes ready to bite our frail monarch's neck! In behalf of the Royal Council, I implore: secure her destiny!

children.name: Text
children.value: Shocking to hear rumours of dissidents nearby. Such a brazen threat to our inexperienced Queen. Play the patriot and stamp out the growing fire.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, what heartless rumours to spread about a grieving widow and a most trusted member of Her Majesty's council. It would be but a favour to the world to strip them from their hearts completely.

children.name: Text
children.value: You of all people must understand how difficult family matters can be. Even when decades apart, one cannot help but worry about the well-being of their kin. My poor niece will grow tired of playing pirates eventually. In the meantime, I'll slit the throat of anyone who dares cut her noble skin.

children.name: Text
children.value: A band of shameless criminals stole away one of Her Majesty's vessels! You must be swift, child, who knows what mischief they could do under the royal flag!

children.name: Text
children.value: "Oh what a doozy, I'd hoped you had not find them yet! Apparently they were found earlier! Don't worry I'm not going to tell on you! Mistakes happen you know!

children.name: Text
children.value: I lost a sentimental piece at sea; a locket... Now Benjamin calls to me, as it is his portrait that lies within. Reunite us.

children.name: Text
children.value: Such a tragedy, our allies, struck at midnight by an invisible foe... Clean the remains of the wreckage, child, and bring them to me. I will see to it that the affairs of the deceased are rightly settled.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, look at the poor travellers, stranded at sea, they must have been caught up in a storm! Bring them to me, child, I will warm them up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Someone has disturbed my dear Benjamin's grave. Please, could you recover what of it remains intact? Meanwhile, I shall slowly mull over a fitting retort...

children.name: Text
children.value: Her Majesty has nothing but kind words towards you, child. Since she commends you so passionately, I have decided to entrust you with the safety of my ship. Hopefully, she will extend her trust once she sees us sail together.

children.name: Text
children.value: Some innocent merchants have had a bit of bother. Could you guide them to my harbour, where they will be quite safe?

children.name: Text
children.value:
Hunt wants the player to escort a scientist who just made a "great discovery", the greatest discovery. Really. She will be able to save humanity.

She is afraid others might want to stop this or steal the knowledge/ideas, so asks for an escort just in case (do we spawn attackers?)

Maybe royale attackers? Or is this too direct?

She portrays the mission as "for the good of humanity", can't imagine anyone wanting to interfere - then there are a lot of attackers, makes the player wonder if intentions are good.

children.name: Text
children.value: As usual, I will be shipping my monthly donation for the New World. Unfortunately, we need and escort, since we have had troubles in the past. Hard to imagine what cool-blooded creatures would have the stomach to steal food and clothes meant for less fortunate children...

children.name: Text
children.value: My dear guest got too infatuated with the Pinot Noir during our celebration in the honour of our beloved Baron Vismark. Take him away discreetly before he embarrasses himself any further, dear.

children.name: Text
children.value: I organised an exhibition in the honour of my late husband, Gilbard Hunt, may the Lord rest his soul. He was very fond of snakes and had a great interest on the venomous species found on the New World rainforests. Now that the exhibition is over, they should be returned to their original habitat unharmed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Come back here, you murderer! I will avenge Lord Vismark even if it costs me my life!

children.name: Text
children.value: Everyone is in such a rush these days, a visiting ship forgot to load up their cargo at my harbour. But I do not forget. Wouldn't you be so kind as to return those crates to them? But be careful, those are dangerous waters.

children.name: Text
children.value: Anne's piracy brings further shame upon our family, but she remains my niece. I cannot be seen to help her foolishness, but perhaps if you were to...

children.name: Text
children.value: Ensuring the peace in the realm sometimes requires distasteful actions, like being involved with nasty characters such as Mr. Graves. Please, deliver this gift to his harbour in behalf of Her Majesty.

children.name: Text
children.value: How can one make a move without knowing what colour are the pieces on the board? An unknown ship has recently docked at Madame Kahina's harbour. Bring me all the information you can gather about them.

children.name: Text
children.value: I know we have had our differences in the past, child, but I still believe we can work together if we cast aside our differences. What do you say, would you do a simple delivery for an old lady?

children.name: Text
children.value: I still pray for the day my niece gives up this buffoonery of piracy and comes back. Bring her a gift from her aunt, let her know my door is always open for her return.

children.name: Text
children.value: It breaks my feeble heart that Sir Archibald could ever doubt the good work we do at The Promise Trust. Bring these letters of appeal to my fellow members of the council. Hopefully, they will understand.

children.name: Text
children.value: I guess they need more persuasion! Can I trust you will see their needs fulfilled?! (maybe slightly annoyed, allthough not worried)

children.name: Text
children.value: The Royal Council has been informed of a suspicious ship sailing on Her Majesty's waters. As a loyal servant of the Queen, I assume you will have no trouble in following and reporting everything you learn about this strange alien.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isn't the royal residence on High Clarence Hall a building of the utmost beauty? It exudes tranquility. I would love to have a framed picture of it on my wall. I hear you have a special talent for photography. Would you mind, dear?

children.name: Text
children.value: I must admit I underestimated you at first, child. You have potential, I'd say you could even become a suitable leader if you keep the right people around you. Here's a token of my appreciation, I hope you accept my apologies.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is an event for the Royal Council approaching and I have heard of a wonderful recipe to spice up the beverages. Bring me these ingredients, child.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, unfortunately my joints are giving me trouble again and I will not be able to attend the party. Still, make sure Sir Archibald receives my special champagne, I poured all my love into it.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have gotten the most dreadful news! A shipment of beer that was suppossed to quench the thirst of my loyal crew was contaminated! You need to get rid of the deadly brew before it reaches them!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am so relieved that they are safe. But they still need to wet their throats. Bring this new shipment of beer to them.

children.name: Text
children.value: How unfortunate, it would seem we didn't quite get the formula right this time... A pity... Still, your name will be remembered, you helped The Promise Trust make great advances, child.

children.name: Text
children.value: Everything is prepared for the big announcement. The Promise Trust is ready to publish the results of our long-running research on the flu. I presume you will take good care of our distinguished guests.

children.name: Text
children.value: The announcement was a complete success. We are so close to finding a cure for the flu. All we need now are tests subjects that are kind enough to trust their lives to us. Would you spread the word around?

children.name: Text
children.value: Marvelous, we have received an overwhelming response. There are many people ready to sail our way, please make sure they arrive safely.

children.name: Text
children.value: The main researcher of The Promise Trust has just arrived at Madame Kahina's harbour, will you pick him up for me? We will also be needing a few more materials to finish this phase, I'm sure you will have no trouble gathering it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Load a ship with the requested amount of goods.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail to the quest giver's harbour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail to the quest giver's harbour and have enough coins in your bank account.

children.name: Text
children.value: Store the requested amount of goods on your island, and confirm the resident's conclusion message.

children.name: Text
children.value: If the resident's conclusion message disappeared, click on the quest resident on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Destroy the enemy's ships with military ships. You can find them by clicking on the quest in the game world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Retrieve the item left after destroying the enemy's ships and bring it back to the quest giver.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship to the requested location. You can find it by clicking on the quest in the game world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once your ship is near the target, pick it up by right-clicking on it. If you don't have enough cargo space, you can drop anything by right-clicking on it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship close to the target ship to start the escort. You can find it by clicking on the quest in the game world.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can command your ships to escort automatically by selecting your ship and right-clicking on the target ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship to the requested location. You can find it by clicking on the quest in the game world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't get into the patrols' sight radius, or else they will attack you. The smaller and faster the ship you use for this, the higher the success chance.

children.name: Text
children.value: Press the "Take photo" button in the quest tracker, and navigate towards the photo object by using the arrow keys and the mouse.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship to the quest giver.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you don't have any space, drop something else overboard by right-clicking a loaded item.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pick up the gift by clicking on the box standing next to the quest resident.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build the requested buildings on any of your islands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build the requested buildings on the island where the quest resident lives.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build the requested buildings on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Answer the enigma by clicking on the requested building on any of your islands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Stay close to the target ship, but don't come too near. Items and cargo can alter the ship speed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sustain the specified criteria above a certain level for the indicated period of time.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once your ship is near the requested location, accept the cargo. If you don't have enough cargo space, you can drop items by right-clicking on them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the pertinent administration and equip it with the correct item or specialist.

children.name: Text
children.value: Click on the target to progress.

children.name: Text
children.value: Use the demolish tool to destroy the target.

children.name: Text
children.value: You need to protect your escortees from possible attacks. Gunboats, Monitors and Battle Cruisers might prove the most effective ships for this task.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can jump to the requested location by clicking on the quest in the game world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring the item with your ship to the specified location.

children.name: Text
children.value: Increase your residents' level of happiness to reach the requested status. Try providing them with luxury goods and public services, or easing their working conditions.

children.name: Text
children.value: Increase your reputation with the pertinent character. Try completing quests for them, flattering them, giving them gifts or signing positive treaties with them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Increase your stock of the requested goods until you can satisfy the solicited amount.

children.name: Text
children.value: Make sure you are selling more goods than you are buying to improve your trade balance. You can adjust the quantities of and what you buy and sell from your trading post's menu.

children.value: We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!

children.name: Text
children.value: To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!

children.name: Text
children.value: It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.

children.name: Text
children.value: In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.

children.name: Text
children.value: We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!

children.name: Text
children.value: But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.

children.name: Text
children.value: Me poor auntie, God rest her soul, left this for me, but whatever would I want it for? I'm sure a cultured one like yerself would appreciate her legacy propper.

children.name: Text
children.value: 'Twas a day like any other, ploughing the field, when m'boy dug this thing up! You like these, don't ye? Don't worry, we already scrubbed it clean.

children.name: Text
children.value: 'Tatoes for dinner, 'tatoes for lunch, 'tatoes for breakfast... I'm so sick of potatoes, please rid us of the bloody stuff!

children.name: Text
children.value: I caught this scamp gobbling all my fish up, but I couldn't bear to hurt it. Will you give him a home?

children.name: Text
children.value: Huh, what a dimwit, he cannot put two words together! I need someone who is in my level, a man of the law... A police officer!

children.name: Text
children.value: He is so serious! I would die of boredom with a man like that by my side! Don't you know someone who knows how to have fun? Maybe someone at the pub?

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, the stench, the depravity, no! You really don't get it, do you? He must be attractive and inteligent, fun yet a decent gentleman! A man of the world! Check the piers!

children.name: Text
children.value: Look at those scrawny shoulders! He'll snip in half if he tries to lift two potatoes!

children.name: Text
children.value: Haven't you seen those dead fish eyes? He gives me the creeps!

children.name: Text
children.value: He couldn't tell his mother from a sheep!

children.name: Text
children.value: My pigs! Gov'nor, you need to help me. See, they've escaped their pen. They're all we got, please get them back!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hubby's a terrific firefighter, but he has the habit of dissapearing after his shift. Last time they found'im passed out by the pub and I'm worried sick he might have fallen somewhere...

children.name: Text
children.value: Gov'nor! Seen my child? Oh, that little rascal, always getting in trouble with that Spuds kid... If you find him, tell him he's going to be the death of me!

children.name: Text
children.value: I swear there is no man in this whole town fit fer me! Look at me! My beauty does not compare to these peasants! You know everyone here, don't you? Find me an attractive husband, like a firefighter!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ma vache! Elle est perdu! Find ma petite Antoinette, I beg of you, she surely doesn't know her way back home...!

children.name: Text
children.value: Bloody hounds have the whole neighbourhood terrorised. Sooner or later a kid's going to end up bitten! Lock them away, ye must!

children.name: Text
children.value: Damned wild animals are eating all my hens! Poor things are so terrified they haven't laid an egg in weeks. Please, gov'nor, catch the rascals!

children.name: Text
children.value: Me pig's been stolen! It's one of the Willington lads I tell ye! See this big 'W' in the mud? Only their fancy boots leave prints like that!

children.name: Text
children.value: Me livestock! Hubs made fun of me when I told him they were up to summat... They all ran away! Our living depends on them, find them, please!

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, how passionate and inspiring! Yes, I shall give this one a chance... For now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oi, heard they've sheep with looong necks on t'other side of the world. I'd kill to see one of those!

children.name: Text
children.value: What a beautiful day for a wedding! Take one of them photographs for the happy couple at the church, will ye?

children.name: Text
children.value: Me Dorothy and I have been preparing for this the whole year: the Cow Beauty Pageant! Or agricultural fair as the others like to call it... Document this wonderful event, yes?

children.name: Text
children.value: Me child's a firefighters' fanatic! He wishes to join the local squad when he grows up. It'd mean the world to him if you could take a picture of the firestation to hang by his bedside.

children.name: Text
children.value: Doctor's told me to stop carrying heavy buckets of water to and fro, but I've many mouths to feed! If only there was a fountain nearby...

children.name: Text
children.value: There's been another accident with the tools we left laying around, someone's goint to get killed one day! Build a kiosk so we can store them safely, will you?

children.name: Text
children.value: My father's too old to be ploughing the fields, but he refuses to stay home! A little shade to keep his head cool would go a long way, if you can spare a tree or two around here.

children.name: Text
children.value: Us farmers have devouted our whole lowly life to harvesting, but none's ever tasted the long yellow fruit they grow in the New World! Wish we could try them at least once in our lifetime...

children.name: Text
children.value: I once had a taste of that canned food artisans enjoy so much and loved it! I wish I were able to afford some of it if only for my wedding feast...

children.name: Text
children.value: Neighbourhood had no time to prepare for the winter, and me ma's knee forecasts a specially wicked one this year. Have you some timber to spare for the fireplace...?

children.name: Text
children.value: I went mushroom picking in the forest and met the most wonderful man, but we were so caught up in the moment that I forgot to ask his name! Do you think I might find him at the pub? Or maybe he's more of a club gentleman...?

children.name: Text
children.value: I waited for hours, but he never came... I guess we were not meant to be... Still, thank you for caring, yer a true friend.

children.name: Text
children.value: There he was, like you said! He was so happy to see me as well! We will remember your help, please take this with our thanks.

children.name: Text
children.value: You know, Guv, I haven't had a thing to complaint about in weeks. Not feeling like meself, honestly. I would even like to give you a gift... What's happening to me?

children.name: Text
children.value: We've so much, Guv, even me orphans are plump. Little Olly just this morning told me "Sir, can I not have some more?". Poor things gave me this for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Those dimwits, skipping our union meeting to drink the second I look away... My comrades need to hear my proposal! Lend me your authority to gather them up, Guv.

children.name: Text
children.value: Me pals, they're so short, you see, they always lose their way to the mines. Good thing is we always make sure to move in a line. Help me find me pals before they miss their shift, yes?

children.name: Text
children.value: Me boy's passionate about the worker's struggle! Maybe even too much. See, he's been handing leaflets to his school mates, refusing to "be oppressed by his bedtime".

children.name: Text
children.value: It's always the same with Old Harold! We arranged our protest on the nineteenth, but out he goes on the ninth all on his own. His bad hearing is going to cost us our reputation! Please shut him up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Could you point me the way to Ah Sing's house? He's got... good ways of making one forget about the hardships of work. It should be easy to spot by the- er... vapour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Miss Alethea's concoctions can clear soot clogged lungs in a whim! She lives high up in the mountains tho, and this cough has me too feeble to climb meself...

children.name: Text
children.value: We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!

children.name: Text
children.value: To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!

children.name: Text
children.value: It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.

children.name: Text
children.value: In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.

children.name: Text
children.value: We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!

children.name: Text
children.value: But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.

children.name: Text
children.value: How am I supposed to brag about punch club if I can't talk about punch club? Oh, I know! The rules didn't say anything about takings pictures...! Meet us at the market place.

children.name: Text
children.value: Me mates and I have shared so many moments working at the brick factory... Jimmy's birthday is coming up and there would be no gift more perfect than a framed picture of the place that brought us together.

children.name: Text
children.value: Can you believe!? Those pigs won't let us in on their precious club. We'll let them know what they can kiss, those... burgoise. You might want to have your camera ready!

children.name: Text
children.value: All this smoke and soot takes a real tool on our bodies. My oldest, she's gotten sick as I've never seen her before. Don't we have a place we can take her to?

children.name: Text
children.value: Our work clothes get stuck in the machines day in and day out. We spend our nights stitching every rip back together! Sure would be nice to have some of those fancy sewing machines...

children.name: Text
children.value: These nuveau riche parading their luxuries around while most of us lowly workers have never tasted a single droplet of cocoa! Even things out, boss!

children.name: Text
children.value: I just became a precious little girl's papa, Guv! We need something fancier to toast just this once, for my baby. You could get us some champagne, right?

children.name: Text
children.value: The community could use some bonding. Help me organise a good old fashioned barbecue, yes? Just get the sausages and bread and I'll take care of the rest!

children.name: Text
children.value: So... My mates wanted to see who's stronger and turns out I won, but... I may or may not need bricks to... rebuild something. Please?

children.name: Text
children.value: Er, is this what champagne tastes like? I'll be sticking to beer then, thank you very much.

children.name: Text
children.value: It would be wonderful if everyone in my cricle were clothed in soft natural fibres! Such timeless and modest garb, surely will be very little trouble to import!

children.name: Text
children.value: Coffee! It must be how Engineers maintain such focus! If I too were worthy of these enchanted beans, I am sure, given time, I might filter the pre-eminent brew of our age!

children.name: Text
children.value: Comic opera requires authenticity as much as any theatre, and the audience will jeer me if the pirates do not all swig rum for the duration...

children.name: Text
children.value: Steam shall never supercede sail in the imagination! I envision canopies of sail above shell-lined walkways, seascapes, and mariner's paraphernalia...

children.name: Text
children.value: Woe! I long for a bucolic life! Perhaps some rural farming family might take me in, and share the very precious simplicity of their lives with me?

children.name: Text
children.value: Erwan Grogg is here! Touring incidental music he composed for a modernist masterwork! If I do not faint, please, I beseech you, will you introduce us? He is sure to be in front of the theatre!

children.name: Text
children.value: When shes is not at church teaching the von Tripp children music, my daughter Maria goes singing and picking edelweiss in the hills. I do hate to interrupt her lessons with the children, but I need her here in the workshop.

children.name: Text
children.value: In the pastry section— a genius. In a new city— a fruitcake! Can you help me find my cousin? He is a huge bold fellow who never parts from his beer, unmissable!

children.name: Text
children.value: At the visitor harbour! Surely you have heard of Mr. Joseph Jefferson, tragedian nonpareil?! His brilliance merits the grandest of welcomes!

children.name: Text
children.value: When I could not see his red chemise, I glanced up, and understood my apprentice had gone. He says he prefers to be his own boss and make money at the theater. There are more wealthy people there than at my little shop for sure ... (sigh) Perhaps I am no natural figure of authority.

children.name: Text
children.value: Please! The first days may well test my resolve, but my heart is wild! It shall carry me through!

children.name: Text
children.value: But I shan't be any burden, I shall be lighter than the country air! And for the dust, I can always wear gloves?

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh thank you, thank you. Saved indeed, saved!... You don't imagine the labour will be too arduous, do you?

children.name: Text
children.value: O, for a taste of distant shores and foreign lips and the elegant shadows of slender leaves...! Still, I cannot leave my earthly prison... To see that paradise, if only in a still picture, would take my breath away...

children.name: Text
children.value: My precious Annabel is about to commence her lifelong voyage of learning! She will shine a light so bright on the world— I must have a picture of her with her fellow pupils!

children.name: Text
children.value: Please, a photograph of us at the zoo! We may never again have the chance before our little Timothy succumbs to his illness.

children.name: Text
children.value: The grand opening! Finally, grandfather's canning plan comes true! A picture will inspire my own grandchildren to preserve...ha!...the business forever...

children.name: Text
children.value: Dubois would take my lovely Rebecca away, but I shall not let him! A photograph of the duel shall prove the lengths to which I am willing to go for her!

children.name: Text
children.value: Seen all there is to see! And if the museum so ceases to stimulate, I am left with naught but my inner monologue, and little in life terrifies more than that!

children.name: Text
children.value: This is one of my great favourites, I have long sought a like-minded soul with whom I might share it!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah, the turbulence of the past is never so dreadful as that of the present! Indeed, I find these ancient artefacts of war quite romantic, as I hope, you will also!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is finally finished! My life's work in art. Dare I dream that by accepting this gift, you intend to make it a centrepiece for the world to admire?

children.name: Text
children.value: It's my favourite time of the year again, the best craftsmen in town all gather for the annual artisan fair! Aren't you excited to greet them and contemplate their masterful work?

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...! Please, take this for the loss of time.

children.name: Text
children.value: These two men claim they are the best poets in the city! Please settle their argument, choose the one you prefer.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Roses are red.

Violets are blue.

Onions stink.

And so do you.

children.name: Text
children.value:
My head is full of random stuff,

Like rusty bread and bits of fluff.

And talking pies with googly eyes,

And stupid stuff that doesn't rhyme.

children.name: Text
children.value: I really hope this final prototype will function as designed outside of a laboratory. Perhaps you would be willing to put it through its paces?

children.name: Text
children.value: These seeds are the product of years of painstaking plant grafting in our botanical nurseries. This crop should now grow on your island as if in its natural climes!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is far too common to see the poor suffer ill health— from smoking chimneys, or the miasma of the mines! It is the life's work of one of my esteemed peers. If you have a position available, I am sure they would work wonders!

children.name: Text
children.value: Charles Darwin, one of the greatest minds of the century is in town! He has been conducting studies about evolution but some of his experience subjects have escaped and are running in the city. If you help him I am sure he would agree to work for you. Start with the fishes close to the harbour!

children.name: Text
children.value: Great! That's the first animal of his experiment! Could you find his crocodiles now?

children.name: Text
children.value: Wonderful! Just need the baboon and we are all set!

children.name: Text
children.value: I just spoke to mister Darwin, he is thrilled to work with a patron so understanding as you. He agrees to move in the city!

children.name: Text
children.value: All these children, sent to the factories as soon as they learn to walk! Such a pity! A child should have a chance to learn to read and acquire skills! Please, convince some workers parents that this is the best for their child, I am willing to teach them for free.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mmh, I can send her my child but there is no way that I am feeding this useless mouth, she will have to take care of it as well!

children.name: Text
children.value: What a wonderful opportunity! I wished I had the same when I was a child.

children.name: Text
children.value: Leaning is the best way for my daughter to understand the pressure classes put on us and fight them effectively!

children.name: Text
children.value: I do need the money my daughter brings by going to the factory but if this allow her to do better than me in life ...

children.name: Text
children.value: Teaching to children? What a weird idea, mine learnt everything she had to know by living the real life!

children.name: Text
children.value: What is she? Some kind of Jean Valjean? Fair enough, let her take care of my son but she better not complain when he will do his usual shenanigans.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have been exchanging for months with a man who calls himself El Professor. He is so intelligent, he seems to always know what I am going to say before I even say it! And now he is coming in the city! I promised I would make him visit the bank. Could you pick him up?

children.name: Text
children.value: Thank you! He loved the bank, he said he will visit it with friends of his soon!

children.name: Text
children.value: People who keep exotic pets, and fail to care for them, seldom realise the damage they do to native animal populations! We must catch the invaders before they take hold!

children.name: Text
children.value: Could you take the photograph, at the front of the University? My daughter has studied eleven hours each day, for five years for this moment!

children.name: Text
children.value: Because I am a woman, many question if the breakthrough really is mine. As such, it gives me the greatest pleasure to be photographed beside the steam shipyard where my new engine will be used.

children.name: Text
children.value: The workers presume I am too fancy to get my hands dirty. But I value field work greatly! A photograph of me visiting the steelworks shall prove it!

children.name: Text
children.value: I wonder what would happen if we tried to photograph a train in motion? Exposure will likely make it a blur, a smudge, but why don't we conduct a little test!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am hosting an academic symposium for my co-authors, and need to feed them all. Experts say fish is good for the brain— please deliver some to my home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Seems we have no time to cook the fish, in part because we can't reach consensus on the best method. Perhaps you could bring some of the tinned stuff instead?

children.name: Text
children.value: My sand-themed paper cannot propound a single unifying theory without the support of experimental evidence! I will need materials!

children.name: Text
children.value: With so much still to be discover, we cannot afford to rest! If recent healthfulness researches are to be believed, my colleagues and I have little to fear from our coffee indulgences!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are presently trying to teach chimps and bonobos to perform human tasks, and would like a fleet of bicycles to wheel them to the park on. Would you be able to help?

children.name: Text
children.value: Most people still fear the light bulb! Think they'll be electrocuted if they touch one! Well, let's bring them out of the dark ages. Help me organise an eastern festival of light, with an undercurrent of education!

children.name: Text
children.value: People of the New World worship me. Hmmn...

children.name: Text
children.value: Everywhere I go, people seem to look through me. Hmmn...

children.name: Text
children.value: An imperfect sphere, white with light, I grow in darkness, the lady's delight. Hmmn, what is it?

children.name: Text
children.value: Break a piece of me off, and I can provide shade. What am I?

children.name: Text
children.value:
When they are green and when they are brown, their bendy mien will cause me to frown. But split in between, for a very short while, they're joyfully yellow and cause me to smile!

What am I?

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm fastest on a full belly, and it sounds like I'm going cheap. What am I?

children.name: Text
children.value:
I stop, it keeps running.
What is it?

children.name: Text
children.value: As the holding company, about time you received some additional benefits, eh? Take some surplus product!

children.name: Text
children.value: An associate has bailed on me at the crucial moment. Perhaps you want these gramophones, at a fraction of the usual price?

children.name: Text
children.value: I brought this back from the last trip, but it really does not befit our mantelshelf as I thought it would. Please, you keep it!

children.name: Text
children.value: Productivity— keyword of our time! Use this machine! It will never ask a wage, be indolent, or show up late!

children.name: Text
children.value: The exhibition opening has been a ripping success! Cause for celebration— one I should be honoured to sponsor!

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm always looking to gain an advantage over the competition! Convince them to back-off, and I predict the markets will pick-up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wood flammable? Hmmn, yes I suppose that is a safety risk, maybe I will invest elsewhere...

children.name: Text
children.value: You're right, I am stressed. And a holiday might keep the whole family quiet for a while...

children.name: Text
children.value: Involved in shady dealings you say? Then I owe you my thanks, and shall withdraw from the deal immediately!

children.name: Text
children.value: I wish to form an investment consortium— and what with so many affluent visitors in the city...any chance you might 'hook us up'?

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh no, I'm terribly sorry, we blew all of our family fortune on this holiday...

children.name: Text
children.value: With a fellow notorious for his disreputable business practices? Never!

children.name: Text
children.value: That sounds a lucrative proposition indeed! I shall accept forthwith!

children.name: Text
children.value: Never mind if Christmas is coming, he shall not have a day off! Where is the fool anyway? Made destitute by his thriftless present-giving perhaps?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr Scrounge may seem miserly, but I am certain a candle of charity burns yet in his heart. I shall wish him greetings of the season as I would any other!

children.name: Text
children.value: Bah! Humbug! What reason has he for being so merry?! I am by far the richer, and yet I find that season abhorrent!

children.name: Text
children.value: If we are to drag this place out of the mire, we need talent. Talent I say! If only we could prise some quality away from Sir Archibald's offices of state...

children.name: Text
children.value: Dashed sorry old chap, but I'm a royalist through and through!

children.name: Text
children.value: For some upstart business nonsense? Are you mad? I work for the Queen!

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes! I will join you. After all, I have always been royally undervalued here...

children.name: Text
children.value: The dratted news boys are delivering yesterday's paper to our subscribers! Quick! Collar them before the Financial Express becomes a laughing stock!

children.name: Text
children.value: He was cavorting through the streets in his underwear! Goodness knows how he arrived at such a state of undress, but he must be stopped!

children.name: Text
children.value: Poor, gentle Nelson, he can't have gone far! My little kitty loves the member's club, maybe he is there hoping to catch a few morsels of food?

children.name: Text
children.value: Every impecunious old family seems to be courting my riches with offers of marriage. A few snaps will ensure I'll get more than just a title—if you know what I mean...

children.name: Text
children.value: A solid, industrious frame, but too ancient! No, this old family factory is a lost cause!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ugh! What tired and tumbledown features! I see no prospects here.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh yes, wowzer! I think we've hit the jackpot. That factory looks ideally situated.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mister Jenkins is the one, I'm sure of it! I pursued him by foot as far as the public mooring— what business can he have there but to be trading my secrets to mafiosi!

children.name: Text
children.value: All they do is complain about being poor! What of hard work? If I did it from nothing, so can they, a photograph of me can prove it!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am smiling for the first time in decades! You must take a photograph! The spirits have shown me the way— oh what a fool I was! I shall give my employee and his family a Christmas to remember!

children.name: Text
children.value: A statue of me will galvanize the layabouts of this city into action! Productivity will soar, and so will profits!

children.name: Text
children.value: What do you take me for? Think I want to mix with the plebeians in a grotty tavern? No! I want membership of an elite club, and to garner social influence!

children.name: Text
children.value: This week has me bored stiff, and I don't have time to work out how to relax. Entertain me! Spoil me with the novel, the exotic, the exquisite!

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you quite mad, sirrah? Who doesn't already have a gramophone?!

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm the one who needs to blow off steam! I don't need an engine to do it for me!

children.name: Text
children.value: Well no surprise in the end, but ever a winner. You know me well! Gold is the one thing I shall never tire of.

children.name: Text
children.value: These charity gala are crucial to do business but annoyingly I need to give to charity to attend. Deliver supplies to "Indigent order" on my behalf, you would be sweet.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fine, they were happy with the delivery. You don't mind me saying I paid for these right?

children.name: Text
children.value: Everyone who's anyone will be at this party, Better make sure the horses get their apples— and this is a whole herd of prime mustang we're talking about!

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm trying to corner the executive lunch rush with these corn flaps from across the water, but I'm going to need a bally sample batch...

children.name: Text
children.value: My darling granddaughter is the only one capable of bringing tears to my eyes. I only hope showering her with gifts will make up for any difficulty I have expressing these feelings.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eh, you know what this is? I went for a walk in the mountains and found my paca nibbling on it. Go on, take it, it's not like I need it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Young lads will go through their lives without ever knowing a good day of honest labour. Bring me them kids so I can teach them what real work looks like!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ha, with those scrawny shoulders he couldn't even lift a sickle!

children.name: Text
children.value: I ... I asked my grand son help me write something for an... old acquaintance from El Puerto. Just... you hand it over, yes?

children.name: Text
children.value: Did she say something? ...No, I don't want to know. I just hope she understands...

children.name: Text
children.value: The alpacas are loose, master! No no no, how could this happen!? Help this old man gather his flock back, por favor!

children.name: Text
children.value: This weather, boss... I swear I never saw animals behave like this. Los cocodrilos, for example, are getting dangerously close to town. Something must be done before a kid gets hurt...

children.name: Text
children.value: Pearl-diving has always been a dangerous job, trust me, I've been doing it since I was a muchacho. But we never had as many problems with the sharks as we do now. Think you can chase them away?

children.name: Text
children.value: My nieto, Miguel, said he was going to visit his abuelita for El Día de los Muertos. But boss, my Antonia passed away years ago! And Miguel still hasn't returned...

children.name: Text
children.value: Ever since my nieta María fed and sheltered that crook Bill, she keeps mumbling something about a grotto in the pirate island. Hell if I know what you will find there...

children.name: Text
children.value: Lama lamaaamasticot lamamasticot! Lama lama masticot lamasticoooot!

children.name: Text
children.value: Well, here we are. Didn't your editor want a picture of us "busy bees of the New World"? To think people waste their time with this petty distractions...

children.name: Text
children.value: My bones get heavier and heavier with each passing day... I would like to have my picture taken. You know, for the family altar, but... We are very poor, boss. You have a picture machine, sí...?

children.name: Text
children.value: When I was a young boy my father took me sailing with him every day. The sea mist, the sails in the wind... I miss it all as much as I miss him.If I had but a picture to bring back all these memories with my pa...

children.name: Text
children.value: No wonder our youths have completely forsaken our values when we don't have a church to spread the gospel truth!

children.name: Text
children.value: My cousin Pablo lost his home to the flames. They have nowhere to stay... If you could only build a new house for them, our entire familia would be forever grateful, boss.

children.name: Text
children.value: Nothing brings us jornaleros as much joy as stroking a sweet guitar. I used to be a luthier back in the day, if you bring me wood, I can make one for everyone.

children.name: Text
children.value: My grandkids keep pestering me to play with them. And I'm not the only one, kids here seem to be utterly bored. With some alpaca wool I could make plush toys for them.

children.name: Text
children.value: I remember my mamá cooking for the whole neighbourhood, spreading joy with her homemade fried plantains. I would like to honour her memory doing the same, if you can spare some plantains and oil.

children.name: Text
children.value: There are rumours of a child striving to survive in the wilderness! People say a bear and a panther look after him, but those are no conditions to live in! Could you find him for me? I will take good care of the poor thing.

children.name: Text
children.value: A gang of horribly corrupter police officers are extorting the good people of this town and beating people up when they refuse to comply. They have threatened me too, but not speaking up against injustice is against my nature!

children.name: Text
children.value: The jornaleros at the corn field, they are so hard-working... Too much for their own good! They need to take their legally required break! They won't listen to us, but I know they'll listen to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Help! My friends has been abducted by La Fortune's brutes! She must be somewhere on his island! Please, I beg of you, bring her back!

children.name: Text
children.value: The war has left many orphans behind... I am committed to doing as much good as I can in the world. If you see a child on the streets, will you send them to me? I will look after them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Gratitude is so often taken for granted... We have decided to give good where good is due. I know it's a small thing, but we wanted to celebrate everything you've done for us with a present.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our family gathers every week to have a lunch together, but and there's always so much food left over! I hate to see it all go to waste. Please, take it and share it with the ones in need.

children.name: Text
children.value: The bridge you have set between our continents is unprecedented! I have learned so much from your Old World, I would love to contribute to spread the knowledge about our culture there as well! Could you take this and set it on display?

children.name: Text
children.value: Nana Angustias passed away and left me her wedding jewelry set. But I don't need it, really. I know it's worth something, I'm sure you can put it to good use and help the less fortunate... I know it is what she would have wanted as well.

children.name: Text
children.value: Today marks the first year anniversary of the rise of our revolution. Your editor wants to feature us freedom fighters in a commemorative article, and since you have been such an inspiration for us it would mean a lot if you could take the snapshot.

children.name: Text
children.value: We are all so proud of all the exemplary improvements you have done here, as should you! Wouldn't it be perfect to celebrate this town with a feature article in your newspaper? It may encourage more people to emigrate to join us!

children.name: Text
children.value: Our society has come such a long way in the past few years! Now a woman can pursue a career in medicine and have her own income and independence without it being frowned upon. My colleagues and I want to set an example for generations to come, could you showcase a picture of us in your newspaper?

children.name: Text
children.value: We are lucky enough to be living times of peace, but many of my comrades are still fighting against the grip of La Corona. They require weapons, but it would be too risky for you to smuggle them yourself. If you entrust me with the supplies, I could sent them to my comrades through our underground network!

children.name: Text
children.value: Many of our comrades are still fighting against La Corona, but their supplies are running low and hunger is starting to wear them down... If you can spare some food, I can make sure it makes their way to them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Most can't imagine how cold nights can get in the open, even if it's warm in daylight. I will never forget the freezing nights when we were running from La Corona. If you can spare some alpaca wool, I can make blankets to send the refugees.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is a real shame that children here have to be home schooled. The experience of sharing knowledge is lost on us. If only we had a museum, we could turn it into a shrine of culture.

children.name: Text
children.value: We have fought long and hard to be rid of tyranny, now is the time for democracy! We need to elect our own representatives, and they can only work from a town hall.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh could you use a machine in one of our factories? I would love to see modernity in the making!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah, the classics of literature! I abhor the thought of people going about their whole lives without ever reading a page. We need to spark the love for the written word! How about a book exhibition?

children.name: Text
children.value: There are still so many war refugees knocking at our doors, Gobernor. If you were to house them, I am sure they would be more than happy to join our flourishing community!

children.name: Text
children.value: All this running around your city has me starving! It sure is beautiful here, but how can I enjoy anything with a rumbling stomach? Ah, if only I could savour the view with a juicy piece of local meat...!

children.name: Text
children.value: Wonderful, my brains runs a lot better when it's all greased up, if you catch my drift. My name is Dennis Brammen, you could say I'm a content creation specialist. I know exactly what you need to get your city the likes it deserves. I'll write a cool article for your newspaper, just take a picture of your deliciously plump piggies!

children.name: Text
children.value: That's what I call a nice partnership! I like you, buddy, you get my sophisticated palate, and the place's not so bad either! I've invited my whole groups of friends to come over, they'll love it here. Let's join them at the pub!

children.name: Text
children.value: This is the yummiest fish I've ever put in my mouth! But come on, fish is barely an appetiser, right? Keep it coming!

children.name: Text
children.value: Damn that wurst was awesome. What an explosion of flavour! But I think it's time for the main course. I hear your beef is praised far and wide for its high quality!

children.name: Text
children.value: Darn right, that's the stuff!! So oily and tender, it melts in the mouth...! It only needs a nice crispy brown toast on the side.

children.name: Text
children.value: My great passion is fashioning costumes to help bring the past to life! If only I had real images to work from, my designs could be all the more authentic. Perhaps you could photograph museum exhibits from the old northern kingdoms, or even our long-lost ancestors from the Bronze Age for me?

children.name: Text
children.value: Such unbelievable wonders! I'm so inspired now, I need to design new clothes! Still, I feel I'm missing something... A breath of fresh air... Or rather, warm air!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is perfect! After studying this picture and your museum meticulously I have come up with a new design, something I believe has never been done before in the world of fashion. But I need materials from the source, oh, if you could bring some to me...!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am so thrilled to have created a piece that brings together the cultures of both the Old and the New World! You have helped me so much, I would love to repay you by spreading my expertise among your people!

children.name: Text
children.value: Those extinct animals you keep are majestic, magical even. This Giant Deer for instance, is certain to canter across the pages of my new fiction. Still, further research is needed, and I need a place to write the thing. Do you happen to have any suggestions?

children.name: Text
children.value: Astonishing animals you have there! I intend to write a story which depends on real and factual observations of the deep seas, and as such, enjoy any challenge to my misconception of the creatures dwelling therein. Perhaps you have more maritime curiosities to share with me?

children.name: Text
children.value: The other writers believe it is fiction, but I am going insane! Something both terrible and terrific lies beneath our feet, in the abyss, the heavens, trapped in the ice. A cult devoting itself to the same monstrous deity gathers in the New World, I must be present to document our end! Bring me pictures, artifacts, build a hospital to care for those plagued by the coming darkness!

children.name: Text
children.value: A farmer's aunt has passed away, leaving her niece a very nice heriloom. Unfortunately, it has no practical use. She would like you to keep it instead.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer's son found something buried in the dirt. She thought you would like to have it.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer has had a very good harvest of potatoes. So good they have too many! She thought you could put the surplus to good use.

children.name: Text
children.value: This fisherwoman caught a seagull feasting on her hard work. She wants to put it in your custody.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer's pigs have escaped their pen and now roam the streets of your city! Help her catch them, they are all she has in the world!

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmer's husband has a record of disappearing and drinking himself to sleep in the streets. She's worried something bad might have happened to him.

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmer's son is a renouned scoundrel and she has lost track of him yet another time. She's worried he might be getting in trouble again and requested your help to find him.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer girl has troubles finding a suitable companion to match her colourful personality. She has requested you help her find a worthy suitor.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer is very close to her cow Antoinette. She is nowhere to be seen and her owner is worried sick. She has asked for your help to find her old friend.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer worries the stray dogs will hurt the neighbourhood children if you do nothing to prevent it. She requests that you lock them away.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wild animals are hunting the farmer's hens! She begs you to catch them before they eat them all up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farmer had her pigs stolen by one of the Willington's brothers. She needs help identifying which one is guilty.

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmer's animals have escaped and she seems to believe they somehow planned it. Find them around town, they are all they have!

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmer really wants to see the alpacas of the New World. You can take a picture of them and send it her way! She will surely be grateful.

children.name: Text
children.value: The most curious bond is being blessed at the Church: Montanes and Capitules, lifelong enemies, are now united by the wedding between their first borns. A picture would set the memory fast in their memories, so they never go back to their old quarrels.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Agricultural Fair is a very special event for farmers, especially this one and her cow! She has asked that you take a picture of the fair for your newspaper.

children.name: Text
children.value: The firefighters are this farmer's son heroes. Encourage his dream of becoming a part of the squad taking his picture in front of the firestation.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer is working very hard to provide for her family. Having a fountain nearby would really lift a heavy burden from her shoulders.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farming tools are dangerous! A few accidents have already stemed from not storing them properly. The farmer would like to have a kiosk to safely put them away.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer's father refuses to retire despite his old age. She has asked that you plant a tree near the field so he can at least get some rest from the sun.

children.name: Text
children.value: This farmer is terribly committed to her craft and would like to learn more about agriculture in other shores. She has requested you bring plantain from the New World for her and her coleagues to taste.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farmer would like canned food for her wedding feast.

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmer is very worried that her family and neighbours do not have enough firewood to last the whole winter. She has asked you for some timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farmer asks for help finding the mysterious man she met in the forest.

children.name: Text
children.value: A Farmer wants to give you a quest.

children.name: Text
children.value: A life without worries is starting to get to this worker. He even has a little something for you, who would have said!

children.name: Text
children.value: The orphans in your town are perfectly healthy and well-fed, they wanted to thank you with a little present.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker's coleagues do not take their union meetings as seriously as he does. He would like your help to find them around town and make them attend.

children.name: Text
children.value: These miners are a close gang, they go everywhere in a line. But not even that prevents them from getting lost in their way to the mines. They'll be in troble if they miss their shift again.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker's son is a true revolutionary! So much that he gets his father in trouble. He would like to help to find him and get him to go to bed.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker's coleague seems to be causing his union a lot of trouble by revolting on the wrong date. He would like you to find him and disperse his one-man protest discreetly.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker has had a very long day and would like to relax at Ah Sing's. He looks a bit disoriented, but you should be able to spot the place easily by the puffs coming out the windows.

children.name: Text
children.value: Soot and smoke are an essential part of a worker's daily life, but they can always count on Miss Alethea's remedies. Provided they can climb to her house in the mountains...

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker desperately wants everyone to know about his after-work activities. Unfortunately, the rules explicitly forbid talking about it... but not taking pictures of it.

children.name: Text
children.value: These brick factory workers are very close pals. They have asked you to take a picture of the workplace that brought them together as a gift for their friend Jimmy.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker wants to protest against the investors for rejecting him at the club, and it looks like he has a peculiar method in mind. He has asked you to take a picture of the... occasion.

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker's daughter has fallen ill due to the pollution from the factories. He asks you to build a hospital so she can be taken care of.

children.name: Text
children.value: The workers have to mend their work clothes every day. They have asked you for sewing machines to make their lives easier.

children.name: Text
children.value: Social inequality is a big concern for this worker. That's why he would like you to bring some chocolate for them!

children.name: Text
children.value: This worker just had a baby girl! They want to toast to her with something classier than a pint of ale, but they cannot afford champagne with their salary...

children.name: Text
children.value: The worker would like to organise a barbacue to bring the neighbourhood together. He has requested you provide the sausages and bread.

children.name: Text
children.value: Looks like this worker is the sad winner of a very destructive competition. He has asked that you lend him some bricks to fix the results of his victory.

children.name: Text
children.value: A Worker wants to give you a quest.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan begs you to supply some fine woollen ponchos.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Artisans find it hard to concentrate on anything without freshly-milled coffee, and hope you may be able to supply it.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like you to supply his touring piratical musical with rum enough for its entire run of shows.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan hopes you might supply him with sails for some sort of as-yet-undefined art fair-cum-maritime forum he has spontaneously conceived.

children.name: Text
children.value: A wistful Artisan believes he is ready to take up the plough, and leave the city behind. He hopes you might find a farming family willing to take him on until he is confident enough to instruct himself.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan has come to you asking to meet the renowned composer who is passing through the city. Perhaps something can be arranged.

children.name: Text
children.value: Maria is a fervent churchgoer, and music enthusiast, who is teaching the von Tripp children to sing. However her father needs her back at his workshop

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan comes to you with news his cousin, a notable pastry chef, has wandered off. If he knew where he was, such a suggestible soul might easily be convinced to work for you!

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan comes to you, anxious you may have overlooked the presence of an acclaimed tragic actor in your city. Massaging the thespian's fragile ego with a welcome may prove mutually beneficial!

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan was too caught in his own dreamworld to keep track of his apprentice, who, having once again shirked his duties, must be found.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...!

children.name: Text
children.value: Forget it! We've had them dandies beofre. By noon he'll be slumped over the plough,  broken and a-weepin'.

children.name: Text
children.value: He'll only be a burden! Met one once who didn't like the 'texture of dust'. Can you imagine?!

children.name: Text
children.value: He'll work for bed and board? Alright, send him along— we can always turf him out! Haha.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like a picture of El Puerto.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like a photograph of his daughter's first day at school, so that she might one day see how her journey to enlightenment began.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like to be photographed alongside his extensive family on the special occasion of their visit to the Zoological gardens.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like the opening of his cannery photographed, so that his scions may remember the day with pride.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like you to photograph a fistfight between him and a rival for the affections of Rebecca, his apparently unrequited love.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan has seen all there is to see at your museum and hopes a new exhibition will be opened soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan offers you a book he imagines you might enjoy.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan would like to present you ceremonial arms once belonging to warriors of antiquity, discovered during a recent amateur excavation.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan has been moved to present you a personal masterwork of his own creation!

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan advices you to visit the Annual Artisan Fair.

children.name: Text
children.value: Artisan would like you to choose who is the best poet.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Artisan wants to give you a quest.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like to you to test her latest invention.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer is offering you seeds to help grow non-native crops on one of your islands.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer recommends you enlist the services of her colleague; a doctor determined to improve living conditions in your city.

children.name: Text
children.value: Engineer would like to teach to Workers' children to grant them a better life.

children.name: Text
children.value: Engineer would like you to meet with El Professor, a man who whishes to visit the city bank.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like you to help Charles Darwin conduct his study on evolution.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like you to stop the Shelley couple from pulling pranks on gullible town people.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like you to find the exotic animals wandering your island, as she worries they may damage local species.

children.name: Text
children.value: An emotional Engineer would like you to photograph her daughter at her University on graduation day.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like to have her photograph taken to revel in her success as a naval engine-builder.

children.name: Text
children.value: An Engineer would like to have her picture taken in front of the steelworks.
